A01.title: Public transport fleet supply
A01.description: Measures the number of public transport vehicles relative to the population. A sufficient supply is crucial for reducing wait times, preventing overcrowding, and ensuring the system can meet public demand.

A02.title: Public transport accessibility
A02.description: Evaluates how much of the city has easy access to frequent public transport. High accessibility is key to making public transport a viable alternative to private cars for more people.

target.metric: 60% of population within 500m of high-frequency transit

A03.title: Walkable streets
A03.description: Assesses the quality and availability of pedestrian infrastructure like footpaths and safe crossings. Good walkability encourages active transport, improves public health, and is essential for first and last-mile connectivity to public transport.

target.metric: 85% of major roads equipped with continuous footpaths

A04.title: Cycling path coverage
A04.description: Measures the extent of safe and high-quality cycling facilities. A comprehensive cycling network promotes a healthy, zero-emission mode of transport and reduces reliance on motor vehicles.

A05.title: Quality drainage coverage
A05.description: Indicates the resilience of the transport network to weather events. Proper drainage prevents flooding that disproportionately affects pedestrians and cyclists, ensuring system reliability.

target.metric: 90% coverage of arterial roads with modern drainage

A06.title: Trained drivers
A06.description: Tracks the percentage of public transport drivers who have completed safety and customer service training. Well-trained drivers are fundamental to ensuring passenger safety, comfort, and overall service quality.

target.metric: 100% of public transport drivers certified in safety protocols

A07.title: Transport investment
A07.description: Represents the financial commitment to developing and maintaining the transport system. Consistent investment is vital for long-term improvements, modernisation, and meeting future mobility needs.

target.metric: 15% of municipal budget allocated to sustainable transport

A08.title: Local traffic flows
A08.description: Measures traffic efficiency and congestion at key locations. Effective enforcement of traffic rules helps maintain smooth flow, reducing travel times and fuel consumption.

target.metric: 10% reduction in peak hour congestion in city center

A09.title: Road obstructions
A09.description: Assesses the impact of encroachments (e.g., street vendors, illegal parking) on road space. Keeping footpaths and carriageways clear is critical for the safety and efficiency of non-motorised transport.

target.metric: 75% reduction in footpath encroachments on major routes

A10.title: Parking management
A10.description: Evaluates the effectiveness of parking regulations and enforcement. Proper management prevents traffic obstruction and ensures that road space is used efficiently and fairly.

target.metric: Implementation of dynamic pricing in 5 key commercial zones

B01.title: Reduction of private vehicles
B01.description: A high ratio of private vehicles is a symptom of a malfunctioning transport system. Reducing this number is a key outcome of providing attractive, sustainable alternatives.

target.metric: 5% decrease in new private vehicle registrations year-on-year

B02.title: Reduction of motorised traffic
B02.description: Measures the overall volume of motor vehicle traffic. Lowering traffic volume is essential for reducing congestion, air pollution, and carbon emissions across the city.

B03.title: Decline in accidents
B03.description: Tracks the rate of traffic-related accidents and injuries. A decline in this rate is a primary indicator of a well-managed, safe, and effective transport system for all users.

target.metric: 25% reduction in serious and fatal accidents

B04.title: Walking and cycling share
B04.description: Measures the percentage of trips made by walking and cycling. Increasing this share is a core goal for creating a healthier, more sustainable, and less congested city.

target.metric: Achieve a 35% modal share for walking and cycling

B05.title: Public transport ridership
B05.description: Tracks the number of people using public transport. High ridership signifies that the service is effective and attractive, leading to greater system efficiency and environmental benefits.

B06.title: Last-mile public transport use
B06.description: Measures the use of intermediate transport (like e-rickshaws or bike shares) for the first and last parts of a journey. Strong last-mile options are crucial for making public transport convenient and accessible.

target.metric: Double the number of integrated last-mile service trips
